memberdef.name: U

detaileddescription.para: one square up the board.

memberdef.name: D

detaileddescription.para: one square down the board.

memberdef.name: L

detaileddescription.para: one square left.

memberdef.name: R

detaileddescription.para: one square right.

memberdef.name: U_U

detaileddescription.para: two squares up.

memberdef.name: D_D

detaileddescription.para: two squares down.

memberdef.name: U_R

detaileddescription.para: one square up and one square right.

memberdef.name: U_L

detaileddescription.para: one square up and one square left.

memberdef.name: D_R

detaileddescription.para: one square down and one square right.

memberdef.name: D_L

detaileddescription.para: one square down and one square left.

memberdef.name: U_U_R

detaileddescription.para: two squares up and one square right.

memberdef.name: U_U_L

detaileddescription.para: two squares up and one square left.

memberdef.name: U_R_R

detaileddescription.para: two squares right and one square up.

memberdef.name: U_L_L

detaileddescription.para: two squares left and one square up.

memberdef.name: D_D_R

detaileddescription.para: two squares down and one square right.

memberdef.name: D_D_L

detaileddescription.para: two squares down and one square left.

memberdef.name: D_R_R

detaileddescription.para: two squares right and one square down.

memberdef.name: D_L_L

detaileddescription.para: two squares left and one square down.

some directions need to filter false positives. for example: moving left one square from the left-most column, will overflow to the previous row. to fix this problem some directions have a andWith value they have to perform a bitwise and with, after every offset. to cancel the false positives. in the left direction example, the andWith is the whole board but the right-most column
The actual offset.
an int for quick access by index.
some
The constant NUM_OF_DIRECTIONS.
The constant NUM_OF_KNIGHT_DIRECTIONS.
The constant NUM_OF_DIRECTIONS_WO_KNIGHT.

memberdef.name: ALL_DIRECTIONS
memberdef.initializer: = values()

detaileddescription.para: The All directions.

memberdef.name: ALL_USED_DIRECTIONS
memberdef.initializer: = Arrays.stream(values()).filter(d -> d != U_U && d != D_D).collect(Collectors.toList())

detaileddescription.para: The All used directions.

memberdef.name: normalPerspective
memberdef.initializer: = PlayerColor.WHITE

detaileddescription.para: the perspective the offset is correct for. if the moving piece's color is not this value the direction need to be flipped.
Gets relative.
Gets direction by offset.
Get combination direction [ ].

gets the correct perspective for the provided player color.this is necessary because for example: a white pawn push(U) is the exact opposite of a black pawn push (D). so the perspective needs to be in relation to the moving color.
the Opposite direction to this one.

Direction - represents a moving direction on a board. sort of like a vector. has an offset that is added to a certain location or bitboard, in order to achieve movement in that direction. the general direction map looks like this:
